description: Creates a new public or private hosted zone. You create records in a public hosted zone to define how you want to route traffic on the internet for a domain, such as example.com, and its subdomains (apex.example.com, acme.example.com). You create records in a private hosted zone to define how you want to route traffic for a domain and its subdomains within one or more Amazon Virtual Private Clouds (Amazon VPCs). For more information about charges for hosted zones, see Amazon Route 53 Pricing. Note the following: When you submit a CreateHostedZone request, the initial status of the hosted zone is PENDING. For public hosted zones, this means that the NS and SOA records are not yet available on all Route 53 DNS servers. When the NS and SOA records are available, the status of the zone changes to INSYNC. The CreateHostedZone request requires the caller to have an ec2:DescribeVpcs permission.

parameters.name: Name
parameters.description: The name of the domain. Specify a fully qualified domain name, for example, www.example.com. The trailing dot is optional; Amazon Route 53 assumes that the domain name is fully qualified. This means that Route 53 treats www.example.com (without a trailing dot) and www.example.com. (with a trailing dot) as identical. If you're creating a public hosted zone, this is the name you have registered with your DNS registrar. If your domain name is registered with a registrar other than Route 53, change the name servers for your domain to the set of NameServers that CreateHostedZone returns in DelegationSet.

parameters.name: VPC
parameters.description: (Private hosted zones only) A complex type that contains information about the Amazon VPC that you're associating with this hosted zone. You can specify only one Amazon VPC when you create a private hosted zone. If you are associating a VPC with a hosted zone with this request, the paramaters VPCId and VPCRegion are also required. To associate additional Amazon VPCs with the hosted zone, use AssociateVPCWithHostedZone after you create a hosted zone. VPCRegion (string) --- (Private hosted zones only) The region that an Amazon VPC was created in. VPCId (string) --- (Private hosted zones only) The ID of an Amazon VPC.

nested_params.name: VPCRegion
nested_params.description: (Private hosted zones only) The region that an Amazon VPC was created in.

nested_params.name: VPCId
nested_params.description: (Private hosted zones only) The ID of an Amazon VPC.

parameters.name: CallerReference
parameters.description: A unique string that identifies the request and that allows failed CreateHostedZone requests to be retried without the risk of executing the operation twice. You must use a unique CallerReference string every time you submit a CreateHostedZone request. CallerReference can be any unique string, for example, a date/time stamp.

parameters.name: HostedZoneConfig
parameters.description: (Optional) A complex type that contains the following optional values: For public and private hosted zones, an optional comment For private hosted zones, an optional PrivateZone element If you don't specify a comment or the PrivateZone element, omit HostedZoneConfig and the other elements. Comment (string) --- Any comments that you want to include about the hosted zone. PrivateZone (boolean) --- A value that indicates whether this is a private hosted zone.

parameters.name: DelegationSetId
parameters.description: If you want to associate a reusable delegation set with this hosted zone, the ID that Amazon Route 53 assigned to the reusable delegation set when you created it. For more information about reusable delegation sets, see CreateReusableDelegationSet. If you are using a reusable delegation set to create a public hosted zone for a subdomain, make sure that the parent hosted zone doesn't use one or more of the same name servers. If you have overlapping nameservers, the operation will cause a ConflictingDomainsExist error.

nested_items.name: HostedZone
nested_items.description: A complex type that contains general information about the hosted zone.

nested_items.name: Id
nested_items.description: The ID that Amazon Route 53 assigned to the hosted zone when you created it.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name of the domain. For public hosted zones, this is the name that you have registered with your DNS registrar.

nested_items.name: CallerReference
nested_items.description: The value that you specified for CallerReference when you created the hosted zone.

nested_items.name: Comment
nested_items.description: Any comments that you want to include about the hosted zone.

nested_items.name: PrivateZone
nested_items.description: A value that indicates whether this is a private hosted zone.

nested_items.name: ResourceRecordSetCount
nested_items.description: The number of resource record sets in the hosted zone.

nested_items.name: LinkedService
nested_items.description: If the hosted zone was created by another service, the service that created the hosted zone. When a hosted zone is created by another service, you can't edit or delete it using Route 53.

nested_items.name: ServicePrincipal
nested_items.description: If the health check or hosted zone was created by another service, the service that created the resource. When a resource is created by another service, you can't edit or delete it using Amazon Route 53.

nested_items.name: Description
nested_items.description: If the health check or hosted zone was created by another service, an optional description that can be provided by the other service. When a resource is created by another service, you can't edit or delete it using Amazon Route 53.

nested_items.name: ChangeInfo
nested_items.description: A complex type that contains information about the CreateHostedZone request.

nested_items.name: Id
nested_items.description: This element contains an ID that you use when performing a GetChange action to get detailed information about the change.

nested_items.name: Status
nested_items.description: The current state of the request. PENDING indicates that this request has not yet been applied to all Amazon Route 53 DNS servers.

nested_items.name: SubmittedAt
nested_items.description: The date and time that the change request was submitted in ISO 8601 format and Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). For example, the value 2017-03-27T17:48:16.751Z represents March 27, 2017 at 17:48:16.751 UTC.

nested_items.name: Comment
nested_items.description: A comment you can provide.

nested_items.name: DelegationSet
nested_items.description: A complex type that describes the name servers for this hosted zone.

nested_items.name: Id
nested_items.description: The ID that Amazon Route 53 assigns to a reusable delegation set.

nested_items.name: CallerReference
nested_items.description: The value that you specified for CallerReference when you created the reusable delegation set.

nested_items.name: NameServers
nested_items.description: A complex type that contains a list of the authoritative name servers for a hosted zone or for a reusable delegation set.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: VPCRegion
nested_items.description: (Private hosted zones only) The region that an Amazon VPC was created in.

nested_items.name: VPCId
nested_items.description: (Private hosted zones only) The ID of an Amazon VPC.

nested_items.name: Location
nested_items.description: The unique URL representing the new hosted zone.
